eftaios.model.managers

Class TurnManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • eftaios.model.managers.TurnManager

extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TurnManager() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      GameEvent beginTurn(java.util.List<Player> playersArray)
      Function that select a new player to start the turn, saves it to the currentPlayer variable, and then returns a GameEvent checking if it's the last turn of the game, the first, or a normal turn Also, resets all the stats of the player by calling a specific function (resetPlayer sets the moves the flags for attacking and everything else)
      Player getCurrentPlayer()
      Function that returns the currentPlayer
      int getCurrentTurn() 
      Player getNextPlayerFromArray(java.util.List<Player> playersArray, Player currentPlayer)
      Function that returns the actual next player from the Array, by checking if the array has been already looped once (then it will return the first element) or still in the process of scrolling through (then will get the element in the currentPlayer position + 1)
      Player getNextRandomPlayerFromArray(java.util.List<Player> playersArray)
      Function that returns a random player from the Array
      void setCurrentPLayer(Player player)
      Function that sets the currentPlayer based on the one inserted as argument

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • getCurrentPlayer

        public Player getCurrentPlayer()
        Function that returns the currentPlayer
        Parameters:
        nothing -
        Returns:
        Player instance of currentPlayer

      • beginTurn

        public GameEvent beginTurn(java.util.List<Player> playersArray)
        Function that select a new player to start the turn, saves it to the currentPlayer variable, and then returns a GameEvent checking if it's the last turn of the game, the first, or a normal turn Also, resets all the stats of the player by calling a specific function (resetPlayer sets the moves the flags for attacking and everything else)
        Parameters:
        array - of players retrieved from playerManager
        Returns:
        EndGameEvent if it's the last turn, StartPlayerTurnEvent if the next player is set to start his turn

      • getNextRandomPlayerFromArray

        public Player getNextRandomPlayerFromArray(java.util.List<Player> playersArray)
        Function that returns a random player from the Array
        Parameters:
        playersArray -
        Returns:
        a random Player

      • getNextPlayerFromArray

        public Player getNextPlayerFromArray(java.util.List<Player> playersArray,
                            Player currentPlayer)
        Function that returns the actual next player from the Array, by checking if the array has been already looped once (then it will return the first element) or still in the process of scrolling through (then will get the element in the currentPlayer position + 1)
        Parameters:
        playersArray, - currentPlayer
        Returns:
        the next player in the array given the one inserted

      • setCurrentPLayer

        public void setCurrentPLayer(Player player)
        Function that sets the currentPlayer based on the one inserted as argument
        Parameters:
        player - to be set as current

      • getCurrentTurn

        public int getCurrentTurn()
        Returns:
        current turn of the game
